title: Which is correct between 'am having four brothers ad two sisters' and 'I have four brothers and two sisters'? - Quora

response.answer_text: The latter is grammatical. The former is not. A statement is “correct” iff it accurately describes the world. If you in fact have 4 brothers and 2 sisters, then your statement is correct; if not, not. You can’t tell whether a particular statement is correct simply by looking at the statement itself; you have to compare it to reality.

“I have…” is correct. “To have” in this sense is a Stative verb, so the present tense does actually tell about the present, and the present continuous tense is not normally used. By contrast, most English verbs are Dynamic verbs, the “present tense” is a misnomer and tells what often/usually/habitually happens, and to tell about the present you need the present continuous tense (“I am doing…”).
